Paver- The Paper Saver App v1.7
While majority of the studentverse may be convinced that doing away with exams is by far the best way to save paper, we tend to think otherwise.

With Paver we try to aggregate data spanning across streams, subjects and semesters, then compile and analyse this data, to find just the right dimensions for our humble answer paper not to get wasted.
Wish there were an app to do the same for our marks üòÖ. Until then, feel free to contribute to the open source project:
Incubated under the aegis of \n Prof Paresh Kale- paresh.iitb@gmail.com \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tDevelopers:\nChinmay Kabi - chinmay.kabi@gmail.com \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tSmarak Das - dsmarak17@gmail.com

AboutNew
Instructions
1: This button is used to add a new subject.Tapping on this takes you to the next screen to enter subject details.

2: These cards represent individual subjects for which you are entering the data. Tapping this will take you to the screen where you enter the data. You can start where you left the data entry for a particular subject.

3: Tapping on this opens up a navigation drawer from the left. It has 4 options which can be accessed by tapping on them. You reached these instructions this way, similarly you can read the about page, send a bug report to the developers and sign out from the app.
4: This displays your name taken from your google account.
1: This is the area where you enter details of the subject.
2: Enter whether the bundle you have is midsem or endsem.
3: Select the stream for majority of the students for that bundle of papers.
4: This button takes you to the next screen where you enter the data for each paper in the bundle.
